channel.title: How to migrate from Hosted Redash ver7 to GCE?
channel.description:
I prepared GCE redash ver8, and using redash-migrate to migrate data. But, 50% of redash-migrate users failed, then redash-migrate queries failed with "no user".
All redash-migrate support is over V9. So I need to update both to V10. I can make V10 GCE instance, but how can I update hosted redash from V7 to V10?
Also, docs say another choise is to dump PostgreSQL and import it to new one. How can I log in to hosted redash?

item.title: How to migrate from Hosted Redash ver7 to GCE?
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
What do you mean by hosted Redash?

Read full topic
item.source: How to migrate from Hosted Redash ver7 to GCE?

item.title: How to migrate from Hosted Redash ver7 to GCE?
item.dc:creator: yishikawa
item.description:
I prepared GCE redash ver8, and using redash-migrate to migrate data.
But,
50% of redash-migrate users failed,
then redash-migrate queries failed with “no user”.

All redash-migrate support is over V9. So I need to update both to V10.
I can make V10 GCE instance, but how can I update hosted redash from V7 to V10?

Also, docs say another choise is to dump PostgreSQL and import it to new one.
How can I log in to hosted redash?

Read full topic
item.source: How to migrate from Hosted Redash ver7 to GCE?
